intro: Ophiopogon acaulis, commonly known as the upright lily or Japanese sedum, is a perennial flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is often dense and evergreen, providing ornamental value in gardens. Ophiopogon acaulis is valued for its low maintenance and ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun.
